intro: Menestoria rigida, commonly known as the rigid menestoria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Menestoria rigida is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its striking floral display.
